metadata.feature_description: Wiki functionality within DNN social groups with group-specific content

steps.action: Navigated to Social Groups > Test Activity Group > Wiki tab
steps.expected: Wiki tab should be accessible within the group
steps.actual: Successfully navigated to group Wiki tab, showing wiki article list within group context

steps.expected: Should display list of articles in the group
steps.actual: Wiki displayed 7 articles in the group including previous test articles

steps.action: Clicked Create Article button and opened dialog
steps.actual: Create article dialog opened with title, content fields, and publishing options

steps.action: Filled in article form with title 'Group Mode Test Article - Jan 2026' and test content
steps.actual: Form fields populated successfully with title, content, and Publish checkbox selected

steps.action: Clicked Create to publish the article
steps.expected: Article should be created and visible in the group wiki
steps.actual: Article created successfully and displayed in the group wiki list

steps.action: Verified group wiki shows articles with GroupId in URL parameter
steps.expected: Group wiki should display group-specific articles
steps.actual: Group wiki displayed 7 articles, URL contains groupId parameter confirming group context

steps.action: Navigated to main Community Wiki (non-group wiki)
steps.expected: Main wiki should not display group-specific articles
steps.actual: Main wiki shows 27 articles but none of the group-specific articles are visible, confirming article isolation

steps.action: Logged out and accessed group wiki as anonymous user
steps.expected: Anonymous user should have limited access to public group wiki
steps.actual: Anonymous user can view public group wiki articles but cannot create new articles - Create button not visible. 'Join Group' button is displayed for non-members.

steps.action: Logged back in as host user
steps.expected: Authenticated user should have full access
steps.actual: Host user has full access including Create, Edit, Delete functionality on group wiki articles

steps.expected: Wiki activity should appear in group activity journal
steps.actual: Activity stream shows wiki journal entries with 'authored wiki article' messages for articles created in the group

steps.action: Clicked 'Unsubscribe from Articles' button in group wiki
steps.actual: Successfully unsubscribed - button changed to 'Subscribe to new Articles'

steps.action: Clicked 'Subscribe to new Articles' to re-subscribe
steps.actual: Successfully re-subscribed - button changed back to 'Unsubscribe from Articles'

steps.action: Opened Edit dialog for a group wiki article
steps.expected: Should have option to move article to different group
steps.actual: Edit dialog opened but no option to change group or move article between groups was found. Checked Common section (Title, Summary, Content, Tags, Article Type) and Advanced section (Approved checkbox, elements toggles) - no group selection or move option available.

issues: No UI option available to move articles between groups - article group association appears to be fixed at creation time

steps.action: Attempted to test private group wiki access
steps.expected: Private group wiki should restrict access to group members only
steps.actual: Only one group exists (Test Activity Group) which is a public group. However, the permissions test confirmed that the system properly restricts actions based on user status - anonymous users could view but not create, and non-members see 'Join Group' button. The code review confirms RequireGroupModeViewPermission and RequireGroupModeChangePermission methods handle private group access restrictions.

observations: Code in ListController.cs and ArticleController.cs confirms GroupId is used to filter and associate articles with specific groups
RequireGroupModeViewPermission and RequireGroupModeChangePermission methods in the service controllers enforce group-based access control
Journal integration is implemented in ArticleController.Add method which calls Journal.Instance.AddWikiToJournal
Subscription system supports group-specific subscriptions through SubscriptionDto.GroupId parameter
No UI functionality exists to move articles between groups - GroupId is set at article creation and can only be updated programmatically via the API
Private group wikis cannot be fully tested in this environment as only a public group exists, but code structure suggests proper implementation
